t: Matthew 17
The Transfiguration
After*p six days Jesus took Peter, James, and his brother John and led them up on a high mountain by themselves.
He was transfigured in front of them, and his face shone like the sun; his clothes became as white as the light.
Suddenly, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with him.
Then Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it’s good for us to be here. If you want, I will set up three shelters here: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
While*p he was still speaking, suddenly a bright cloud covered them, and a voice from the cloud said, “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well-pleased. Listen to him!”
When the disciples heard this, they fell facedown and were terrified.
Jesus*p came up, touched them, and said, “Get*r up;*r don’t*r be*r afraid.”*r
When they looked up they saw no one except Jesus alone.
As*p they were coming down the mountain, Jesus commanded them, “Don’t*r tell*r anyone*r about*r the*r vision*r until*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r raised*r from*r the*r dead.”*r
So*p the disciples asked him, “Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
“Elijah*rp is*r coming*r and*r will*r restore*r everything,”*r he replied.

“But*r I*r tell*r you:*r Elijah*r has*r already*r come,*r and*r they*r didn’t*r recognize*r him.*r On*r the*r contrary,*r they*r did*r whatever*r they*r pleased*r to*r him.*r In*r the*r same*r way*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r going*r to*r suffer*r at*r their*r hands.”*r
Then the disciples understood that he had spoken to them about John the Baptist.
The Power of Jesus over a Demon
When*p they reached the crowd, a man approached and knelt down before him.
“Lord,” he said, “have mercy on my son, because he has seizures and suffers terribly. He often falls into the fire and often into the water.
I brought him to your disciples, but they couldn’t heal him.”
Jesus*p replied, “You*r unbelieving*r and*r perverse*r generation,*r how*r long*r will*r I*r be*r with*r you?*r How*r long*r must*r I*r put*r up*r with*r you?*r Bring*r him*r here*r to*r me.”*r
Then Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of him, and from that moment the boy was healed.
Then*p the disciples approached Jesus privately and said, “Why couldn’t we drive it out?”

“Because*rp of*r your*r little*r faith,”*r he told them. “For*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r if*r you*r have*r faith*r the*r size*r of*r a*r mustard*r seed,*r you*r will*r tell*r this*r mountain,*r ‘Move*r from*r here*r to*r there,’*r and*r it*r will*r move.*r Nothing*r will*r be*r impossible*r for*r you.”*r
The Second Prediction of His Death
As*p they were gathering together in Galilee, Jesus told them, “The*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r about*r to*r be*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r men.*r
They*r will*r kill*r him,*r and*r on*r the*r third*r day*r he*r will*r be*r raised*r up.”*r And they were deeply distressed.
Paying the Temple Tax
When*p they came to Capernaum, those who collected the temple tax approached Peter and said, “Doesn’t your teacher pay the temple tax?”

“Yes,”*p he said. When*p he went into the house, Jesus spoke to him first, “What*r do*r you*r think,*r Simon?*r From*r whom*r do*r earthly*r kings*r collect*r tariffs*r or*r taxes?*r From*r their*r sons*r or*r from*r strangers?”*r
“From*p strangers,” he said. “Then*rp the*r sons*r are*r free,”*r Jesus told him.

“But,*r so*r we*r won’t*r offend*r them,*r go*r to*r the*r sea,*r cast*r in*r a*r fishhook,*r and*r take*r the*r first*r fish*r that*r you*r catch.*r When*r you*r open*r its*r mouth*r you’ll*r find*r a*r coin.*r Take*r it*r and*r give*r it*r to*r them*r for*r me*r and*r you.”*r
